rules: Rule1: If the research project receives government grant funding, then the clinical trial does not use the digital monitoring platform.

Rule2: Either the pharmaceutical corporation acquires the research team, or if the research team develops a portable drug dispenser device, then the research project receives government grant funding.
Rule3: If the research team publishes results in a peer-reviewed journal, then the experimental drug completes development.
Rule4: If the research team presents findings at a medical conference, then the experimental drug completes development.
Rule5: If the research team secures a patent for the drug formula, then the research team publishes results in a peer-reviewed journal.
Rule6: Either the research team secures a patent for the drug formula, or the research team forms a partnership with a university laboratory.
Rule7: If the research team forms a partnership with a university laboratory, then the research team presents findings at a medical conference.
Rule8: If it is not the case that having FDA authorization approval leads to the experimental drug completing development, then the clinical trial uses the digital monitoring platform.
Rule9: If it is not the case that having FDA authorization approval leads to the experimental drug completing development, then the research team develops a portable drug dispenser device.
facts: Fact1: The research team has FDA authorization approval.
Fact2: The pharmaceutical corporation does not acquire the research team.
